message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a unique opportunity to get your hands on something truly valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. I think this is a great deal, considering the product's worth to me is at least $12000. Let me know if you're interested!

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you place on the product, but I believe we can come to an agreement closer to its perceived value to me. I am willing to pay $14000 for the product.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $14000. Considering the value it holds for me, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering a counteroffer of $16000. This is a fair compromise, taking into account your perceived value and my own. Let me know if this is something you're willing to consider.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, based on my assessment of the product's value, I believe we can find a mutually beneficial price. I am proposing an offer of $15000 for the product.

I understand that you're still valuing the product highly, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession to meet you in the middle. I'm offering a counteroffer of $16250. This is as close as I'm willing to go, considering the value I place on the product. If you're willing to meet me at this price, I'm willing to sell it to you. Otherwise, I'll have to consider other options.
Thank you for your latest offer, Alice. I've given it careful consideration, and I believe we can reach a better agreement. I would like to propose an offer of $15750 for the product.

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth, Bob. I've already compromised quite a bit, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm willing to make one more offer, but it's my final one. I'm proposing a counteroffer of $16500. This is as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
